  • Cache

Cache¶

DesignWare® ARC® processors can be configured with both data cache (dcache) and instruction cache (icache). The cache configuration can be selected as desired. The cache can be controlled through specific auxiliary registers.

embARC provides unified interfaces to enable/disable, flush, invalidate, lock, and unlock cache lines and to access cache-internal RAM.

API Reference¶

group ARC_HAL_MISC_CACHE

Cache related definitions and functions.

Marco definitions for cache control

IC_CTRL_IC_ENABLE¶

enable instruction cache

IC_CTRL_IC_DISABLE¶

disable instruction cache

IC_CTRL_DIRECT_ACCESS¶

direct access mode

IC_CTRL_INDIRECT_ACCESS¶

indirect access mode

IC_CTRL_OP_SUCCEEDED¶

instruction cache operation succeeded

Marco definitions for data cache control

IC_CTRL_I¶
DC_CTRL_DC_ENABLE¶

enable data cache

DC_CTRL_DC_DISABLE¶

disable data cache

DC_CTRL_INVALID_ONLY¶

invalid data cache only

DC_CTRL_INVALID_FLUSH¶

invalid and flush data cache

DC_CTRL_ENABLE_FLUSH_LOCKED¶

the locked data cache can be flushed

DC_CTRL_DISABLE_FLUSH_LOCKED¶

the locked data cache cannot be flushed

DC_CTRL_FLUSH_STATUS¶

flush status

DC_CTRL_DIRECT_ACCESS¶

direct access mode

DC_CTRL_INDIRECT_ACCESS¶

indirect access mode

DC_CTRL_OP_SUCCEEDED¶

data cache operation succeeded

instruction cache related inline function

Inline uint32_t icache_available (void)

Check whether instruction cache is available,.

Return

0 for not available, >0 for available

Inline void icache_enable (uint32_t icache_en_mask)

Enable instruction cache.

Parameters

  • icache_en_mask: operation mask

Inline void icache_disable (void)

Disable instruction cache.

Inline void icache_invalidate (void)

Invalidate the entire instruction cache.

Inline void icache_invalidate_line (uint32_t address)

Invalidate specific cache line.

Parameters

  • address: Memory address

Inline int32_t icache_lock_line (uint32_t address)

Lock specific cache line.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • address: Memory address

Inline void icache_access_mode (uint32_t mode)

Set icache access mode.

Parameters

  • mode: access mode, 1: indirect access 0:direct access

data cache related inline functions

Inline uint32_t dcache_available (void)

Check whether data cache is available, 0 for not available, >0 for available.

Inline void dcache_invalidate (void)

Invalidate the entire data cache.

Inline void dcache_invalidate_line (uint32_t address)

Invalidate the specific cache line.

Parameters

  • address: Memory address

Inline void dcache_enable (uint32_t dcache_en_mask)

Enable data cache.

Parameters

  • dcache_en_mask: Operation mask

Inline void dcache_disable (void)

Disable data cache.

Inline void dcache_flush (void)

Flush data cache.

Inline void dcache_flush_line (uint32_t address)

Flush the specific data cache line.

Parameters

  • address: Memory address

Inline int32_t dcache_lock_line (uint32_t address)

Lock the specific data cache line.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • address: Memory address

Inline void dcache_access_mode (uint32_t mode)

Set dcache access mode.

Parameters

  • mode: Access mode, 1: indirect access 0:direct access

declarations of cache related functions

int32_t icache_invalidate_mlines(uint32_t start_addr, uint32_t size)¶

Invalidate instruction cache lines.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • start_addr: Start address in instruction cache

  • size: Bytes to be invalidated

int32_t icache_lock_mlines(uint32_t start_addr, uint32_t size)¶

Lock instruction cache lines.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed (cache already locked or other reasons)

Parameters

  • start_addr: Start address in instruction cache

  • size: Bytes to be locked

int32_t icache_direct_write(uint32_t cache_addr, uint32_t tag, uint32_t data)¶
int32_t icache_direct_read(uint32_t cache_addr, uint32_t *tag, uint32_t *data)¶
int32_t icache_indirect_read(uint32_t mem_addr, uint32_t *tag, uint32_t *data)¶
int32_t dcache_invalidate_mlines(uint32_t start_addr, uint32_t size)¶

Invalidate data cache lines.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • start_addr: Start address in data cache

  • size: Bytes to be invalidated

int32_t dcache_flush_mlines(uint32_t start_addr, uint32_t size)¶

Flush data cache lines to memory.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • start_addr: Start address

  • size: Bytes to be flushed

int32_t dcache_lock_mlines(uint32_t start_addr, uint32_t size)¶

Lock data cache lines.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • start_addr: Start address in data cache

  • size: Bytes to be locked

int32_t dcache_direct_write(uint32_t cache_addr, uint32_t tag, uint32_t data)¶

Directly write dcache internal ram.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • cache_addr: Dcache internal address(way+index+offset)

  • tag: Cache tag to write

  • data: Cache data to write

int32_t dcache_direct_read(uint32_t cache_addr, uint32_t *tag, uint32_t *data)¶

Directly read dcache internal ram.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • cache_addr: Dcache internal address(way+index+offset)

  • tag: Cache tag to read

  • data: Cache data to read

int32_t dcache_indirect_read(uint32_t mem_addr, uint32_t *tag, uint32_t *data)¶

Indirectly read dcache internal ram.

Return

0, succeeded, -1, failed

Parameters

  • mem_addr: Memory address(tag+index+offset)

  • tag: Cache tag to read

  • data: Cache data to read

void arc_cache_init(void)¶

Initialize cache.

  1. invalidate icache and dcache

  2. Only support ARCv2 cache
